title: Question about Rajya Sabha members sitting in Lok Sabha during No Confidence Vote
selftext:
During the No Confidence vote against the Modi govt. in the Lok Sabha yesterday, I noticed that some Rajya Sabha members were sitting in the Lok Sabha (Nirmala Sitharaman, S. Jaishankar, Hardeep Singh Puri).

I didn't find this unusual, because they may have been there are ministers whose consultation might be needed during the debate, etc.

However, I was surprised that they didn't leave the Lok Sabha before the voice vote. **Why were they allowed to sit in the Lok Sabha crowd during the voice vote?**

Also, right after the no-confidence vote was won by the Modi govt., there was a proposal to suspend Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury. I distinctly noticed Hardeep Singh Puri raise his hand in affirmation, during the voice vote on that issue (3:19 in this video [https://youtu.be/PPW42yiIXDs?t=199](https://youtu.be/PPW42yiIXDs?t=199) ). **How come he was allowed to participate in a Lok Sabha vote? Is there something I'm missing?**
